# isInspectable

**Instance Property**

Indicates whether you can inspect the page with Safari Web Inspector.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor final var isInspectable: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set to `true` at any point in the page’s lifetime to allow Safari Web Inspector access to inspect the view’s content. Then, select your view in Safari’s Develop menu for either your computer or an attached device to inspect it.

If you set this value to false during inspection, the system immediately closes Safari Web Inspector and does not provide any further information about the web content.

The default value of this property is `false`.

## Inspecting page information

- **WebPage.CSSMediaType**: A CSS media type as defined by the [https://www.w3.org/TR/mediaqueries-4/#media-types], or an arbitrary media type value.
- **title**: The page title.
- **url**: The URL for the current webpage.
- **mediaType**: The media type for the contents of the webpage.
- **customUserAgent**: The custom user agent string.
- **serverTrust**: The trust management object you use to evaluate trust for the current webpage.
- **hasOnlySecureContent**: Indicates whether the webpage loaded all resources on the page through securely encrypted connections.
- **themeColor**: The theme color that the system gets from the first valid meta tag in the webpage.
- **isBlockedByScreenTime**: Indicates whether Screen Time blocking has occurred.
- **isWritingToolsActive**: Indicates whether Writing Tools is active for the page.
